title: Taoiseach - Wikipedia
snippet: The incumbent Taoiseach is Micheál Martin, TD, leader of Fianna Fáil, who took office on 23 January 2025, following the 2024 general election and an agreement between Fianna Fáil, Fine Gael and independent TDs.

title: Dáil Éireann: Micheál Martin elected taoiseach after chaos subsides
snippet: Fianna Fail leader Micheál Martin has been elected taoiseach (Irish prime minister) for the second time after chaos in the Dáil (lower house of Irish Parliament) subsided.

title: Micheál Martin: Ireland finally appoints new prime minister after chaos in parliament | CNN
snippet: Micheál Martin became Ireland’s taoiseach (prime minister) for the second time in his political career on Thursday, a day later than planned.

title: Taoiseach | Meaning, Pronunciation, & List of Heads of Government of Ireland | Britannica
snippet: The taoiseach is the head of government of Ireland. The taoiseach must be a member of the Dail Eireann (House of Representatives), the lower house of the Oireachtas (Parliament).

title: Government of Ireland - Wikipedia
snippet: The Government of Ireland (Irish: Rialtas na hÉireann) is the executive authority of Ireland, headed by the Taoiseach, the head of government. The government – also known as the cabinet – is composed of ministers, each of whom must be a member of the Oireachtas, which consists of Dáil Éireann and Seanad Éireann.
